trans-unit.source: Allows Visual Studio to communicate internally with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control is browsing a COM object and the user renames the object.

Only a change of value of the property that corresponds to DISPID_Name for the COM object raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComponentModel.Com2Interop.IComPropertyBrowser.ComComponentNameChanged> event.
Closes any open drop-down controls on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control.
Commits all pending changes to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> successfully commits changes; otherwise, `false`.
Activates the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control when the user chooses **Properties** for a control in Design view.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control is currently setting one of the properties of its selected object.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control is currently setting one of the properties of its selected object; otherwise, `false`.
Loads user states from the registry into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control.

You can save some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control states, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.HelpVisible%2A> properties, to the registry and load them the next time the user runs your application.
The registry key that contains the user states.
Saves user states from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control to the registry.

You can save some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control states, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.HelpVisible%2A> properties, to the registry and load them the next time the user runs your application.
The registry key that contains the user states.
